speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: SCENE I. The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Enter ACHILLES and PATROCLUS

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: I'll heat his blood with Greekish wine to-night,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Which with my scimitar I'll cool to-morrow.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Patroclus, let us feast him to the height.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Here comes Thersites.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Enter THERSITES

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: How now, thou core of envy!

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Thou crusty batch of nature, what's the news?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Why, thou picture of what thou seemest, and idol

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: of idiot worshippers, here's a letter for thee.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: From whence, fragment?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Why, thou full dish of fool, from Troy.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Who keeps the tent now?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: The surgeon's box, or the patient's wound.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Well said, adversity! and what need these tricks?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Prithee, be silent, boy; I profit not by thy talk:

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: thou art thought to be Achilles' male varlet.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Male varlet, you rogue! what's that?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Why, his masculine whore. Now, the rotten diseases

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: of the south, the guts-griping, ruptures, catarrhs,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: loads o' gravel i' the back, lethargies, cold

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: palsies, raw eyes, dirt-rotten livers, wheezing

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: lungs, bladders full of imposthume, sciaticas,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: limekilns i' the palm, incurable bone-ache, and the

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: rivelled fee-simple of the tetter, take and take

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: again such preposterous discoveries!

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Why thou damnable box of envy, thou, what meanest

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: thou to curse thus?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Do I curse thee?

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Why no, you ruinous butt, you whoreson

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: indistinguishable cur, no.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: No! why art thou then exasperate, thou idle

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: immaterial skein of sleave-silk, thou green sarcenet

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: flap for a sore eye, thou tassel of a prodigal's

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: purse, thou? Ah, how the poor world is pestered

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: with such waterflies, diminutives of nature!

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Out, gall!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Finch-egg!

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: A token from her daughter, my fair love,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Both taxing me and gaging me to keep

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it:

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent:

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: This night in banqueting must all be spent.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Away, Patroclus!

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Exeunt ACHILLES and PATROCLUS

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: With too much blood and too little brain, these two

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: may run mad; but, if with too much brain and too

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: little blood they do, I'll be a curer of madmen.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow enough and one

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: that loves quails; but he has not so much brain as

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: earwax: and the goodly transformation of Jupiter

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: there, his brother, the bull,--the primitive statue,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: and oblique memorial of cuckolds; a thrifty

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his brother's

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: leg,--to what form but that he is, should wit larded

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: with malice and malice forced with wit turn him to?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: To an ass, were nothing; he is both ass and ox: to

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: an ox, were nothing; he is both ox and ass. To be a

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a lizard, an

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: owl, a puttock, or a herring without a roe, I would

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: against destiny. Ask me not, what I would be, if I

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: were not Thersites; for I care not to be the louse

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus! Hey-day!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: spirits and fires!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Enter HECTOR, TROILUS, AJAX, AGAMEMNON, ULYSSES, NESTOR, MENELAUS, and DIOMEDES, with lights

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: We go wrong, we go wrong.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: No, yonder 'tis;

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: There, where we see the lights.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I trouble you.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: No, not a whit.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Here comes himself to guide you.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Re-enter ACHILLES

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Welcome, brave Hector; welcome, princes all.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: So now, fair prince of Troy, I bid good night.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Ajax commands the guard to tend on you.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Thanks and good night to the Greeks' general.

speaker: MENELAUS
text_entry: Good night, my lord.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Good night, sweet lord Menelaus.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Sweet draught: 'sweet' quoth 'a! sweet sink,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: sweet sewer.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Good night and welcome, both at once, to those

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: That go or tarry.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Good night.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Exeunt AGAMEMNON and MENELAUS

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Old Nestor tarries; and you too, Diomed,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Keep Hector company an hour or two.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I cannot, lord; I have important business,

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: The tide whereof is now. Good night, great Hector.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Give me your hand.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: [Aside to TROILUS]  Follow his torch; he goes to

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Calchas' tent:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: I'll keep you company.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Sweet sir, you honour me.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: And so, good night.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Exit DIOMEDES; ULYSSES and TROILUS following

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Come, come, enter my tent.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Exeunt ACHILLES, HECTOR, AJAX, and NESTOR

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: unjust knave; I will no more trust him when he leers

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: than I will a serpent when he hisses: he will spend

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: his mouth, and promise, like Brabbler the hound:

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: but when he performs, astronomers foretell it; it

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: borrows of the moon, when Diomed keeps his

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: word. I will rather leave to see Hector, than

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: not to dog him: they say he keeps a Trojan

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent: I'll

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: after. Nothing but lechery! all incontinent varlets!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Exit
